About Reports

Serena ChangeMan Version Manager provides the following types of reports:

  • A journal report, which contains information about actions that modify an archive.
  • A history report, which contains information about archives: the archive and workfile names, the archive description, revision numbers, revision history, and more. Note that the history report was called archive report in previous releases of Version Manager.
  • A security report, which contains the security settings in the access control database.
  • A difference report, which shows the differences between a revision and a workfile, revisions in a single versioned file, two versioned files, or two workfiles.

In the desktop client, you can display reports in an HTML browser or text editor. On Windows platforms, if you want to display reports in HTML format, Version Manager uses your default browser. On UNIX platforms, if you want to display reports in HTML format, you must specify which HTML browser to use. These options are selected on the Applications tab of the Options dialog box (select View | Options, then click the Applications tab).

NOTE In addition to these reports, Version Manager records changes to the contents of projects, such as adding or removing subprojects or versioned files. These changes are recorded in a change.log file located in the root directory of the project database.
